channel.title: Server Help Suggestions
channel.description: 1) Make a post requirement to post on there 2) Actually check to see who is making multiple accounts and discipline accordingly in that section 3) I suggest making different "level" boards for server help. Let me explain... there could be an "amateur" , "intermediate" and a "professional" level board. These boards would be moderated as seen fit and would then make it easier on us to decipher who is wanting to be spoonfeed and who is just wanting general advice. 4) If #3 is "out of the question" then I believe we need some sort of system put in place to stop spoonfeeding overall. You know sometimes it isn't so bad to just google something for somebody and give them a link...but whena person doesn't even TRY to learn that's when it becomes an insult to a helpers timer.

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

There should also be some "evidence" of their own attempts before we provide further support?

Why should I spend 30 seconds googling what they could had?

edit:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

THIS is a an example of a good help topic

Now you won’t see this in most help topics that’s the issue I have with the section.

-he at least attempted (even if logic wasn’t in his favor lol)
-he is willing to do the heavy work
-and he is willing to work off what he gets

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

At rule #5 - nobody is saying having stupid topic titles is good, it’s just not worth it trying to moderate them because it happens so often. They get their own punishment by not getting the question answered

At rule #3 - Same thing pretty much. In a perfect world, all new members here would be willing to learn and all of the current members would be willing to take the time to teach in help threads. Just isnt going to happen, and enforcing that rule strictly is going to kill the development on the site.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:47, topic:526795”]I said it was a good idea, not a rule, wtf[/quote]was in quotes so I assumed
Went and reviewed the server help "rules’ and now I have to question why there isn’t more enforcement…

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

^ That’s a quoted post in server help rules and well yeah…like a good 75% of the topics in that section would be voided because of that.

5. Make sure the titles of your topics are easy to read and are completely relevant to the topic at hand. Though this rule may be bent from time to time, make sure you follow it. A moderator on a bad day could easily lock a topic for breaking this rule.

I wouldn’t consider “omg help me!@@@” being “relevant” …

3. We are not a Spoonfeeding community. We do not teach in an oversimplified manner to discourage independent thought. We encourage independent thought, meaning you must help yourselves before requesting help. Failure to provide some sort of prior knowledge or work to the problem will result in a lock of the topic. This is final.

So in reality, I was right to think that there should be NO spoonfeeding. There should also be some “evidence” of their own attempts before we provide further support?

Read full topic

I said it was a good idea, not a rule, wtf

item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:45, topic:526795”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=645543.msg4344713#msg4344713 date=1375711228]
David if that’s another rule why is it loosely followed? 0_o…
[/quote]What[/quote]

It appears you already have an active help topic created in the last 3 days, please try and put all of your server help questions into one topic. This can be done by creating a new reply to your own help topic or editing the main help topic post.
[/quote]

^ You said that

assuming that’s a rule or something in server help ~^ so why is it only loosely followed. I know for a fact I have reported several posts in the past for multiple topics and dependent on the mod who looks at it it may/may not get locked/combined.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Vain_, post:39, topic:526795”]stop talking about restricting people from posting in the section as a whole without requirements. just limit the posting for multiple topics. that will limit the amount of spam topics, encourage others to follow the rule about putting all your questions in one topic etc.[/quote]That wouldn’t be a bad idea:

It appears you already have an active help topic created in the last 3 days, please try and put all of your server help questions into one topic. This can be done by creating a new reply to your own help topic or editing the main help topic post.

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:34, topic:526795”]Because a “quick answer” isn’t real help. That’s just doing the work for them.[/quote]That is still help, lol. It’s not as effective learning, but it is definitely still help. It’s like teaching a man to fish vs giving him a fish. You can feed him for a day so he doesn’t starve, which is still better than nothing if he doesn’t want you to teach him how to fish. Eventually he might give in and want to actually learn, but you can’t force someone to learn if they dont want to. Doesn’t mean we shouldn’t at least help them wet their toes in the world of RSPS. (The metaphor equivalent would be trying to teach him to fish before he even knows if he likes the taste of fish, you should let him decide if he wants to bother learning or not based on whether he enjoys it)

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:31, topic:526795”][quote author=Travas link=topic=645543.msg4344027#msg4344027 date=1375584498]
I agree with David. If you don’t let people who need help with RSPS post in server help, then where do you expect them to post? Do you really want all other boards to become help boards?
[/quote]there isn’t anything wrong with people asking for help if you don’t understand something I am all for assisting that person. However as I already stated people such as Sk8 and myself. Try to help in a way in which it will also help the persont o learn his own self. However it becomes a hindrance when they aren’t willing to learn and just want a “quick answer”

If I remember correctly wasn’t mopar founded on the terms of " teaching hacking"

(or something around those grounds? )[/quote]I don’t get why you are trying to restrict the person from posting if they want a ‘quick answer’.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:31, topic:526795”][quote author=Travas link=topic=645543.msg4344027#msg4344027 date=1375584498]
I agree with David. If you don’t let people who need help with RSPS post in server help, then where do you expect them to post? Do you really want all other boards to become help boards?
[/quote]there isn’t anything wrong with people asking for help if you don’t understand something I am all for assisting that person. However as I already stated people such as Sk8 and myself. Try to help in a way in which it will also help the persont o learn his own self. However it becomes a hindrance when they aren’t willing to learn and just want a “quick answer”

If I remember correctly wasn’t mopar founded on the terms of " teaching hacking"

(or something around those grounds? )[/quote]Unfortunately that is just going to be the case. If you don’t want to spoonfeed people and they don’t want to learn, you don’t have to help them. But if we just stop people from posting because are curious about RSPS but maybe not quite up to the daunting task of learning programming to really get into it yet, the community is going to die even faster. It’s just a bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I believe it has been posted about before, but why not have a pop up that directs a user to a few topics that can be viewed over before they create a topic. These topics can include our compilation of common compiling errors, the rules of the board, hell why not a link to google also. If the user still cannot find the answer from any of those sources then they can just click a close button or a big red x and create their topic. This shouldn’t really hinder anyone, and if they wish to not continuing reviewing it they can hit a button that adds a cookie.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:27, topic:526795”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=645543.msg4344014#msg4344014 date=1375581559]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=645543.msg4344006#msg4344006 date=1375580954]
having more posts shouldn’t be encouraged or expected when the posts there are generally multi-posts, spam posts, or retarded posts.
[/quote]Was only really talking about having a required # of posts to post there
[/quote]I see where you are coming from David but here is my thing if the person isn’t even willing to at least try then it becomes a hindrance on the people who actually try to teach instead of spoonfeed. Then they get mad at us/flame us. And even worse, a day later we will see three more topics about the same issue because we didn’t hold their hand.[/quote]Where are they going to post to prove they are willing to “try” before they can ask for help? Should they talk in general discussion first? Does that prove they ‘tried’? Maybe make a downloads topic or tutorial? It just doesn’t make any sense to have a requirement to post in server help.

Read full topic
